bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1941

div1.p: Clemons thanks Hench for the reprint of his yellow fever article.

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1941
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
21 November 1941
HARRY CLEMONS
LIBRARIAN
MARY LOUISE DINWIDDIE
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
We are heartily grateful for
the reprint copy of your address on ‘Conquerors
of Yellow Fever.’ Your contributions to the his-
tory of the events of 1900 have been most impres-
sive and have given fresh significance to that
vital subject. We are especially glad to be able
to add this article to the group of materials that
have from time to time come from you and General
Kean and Sergeant Moran and others.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian To Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
HC:MT
